abstract.text: The units to use when formatting a byte count, such as kilobytes or gigabytes.

abstract.text: The locale to use to format the numeric part of the byte count.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the format style should spell out zero-byte values as text.
The units the format style can use to express the byte count.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the format style should include the exact byte count, in addition to expressing it in terms of units.
The units to use when formatting a byte count, such as kilobytes or gigabytes.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given element is a member of the option set.
Encodes this value into the given encoder, when the type’s
is
Removes all elements of this option set that are not also present in the given set.
Replaces this set with a new set containing all elements contained in either this set or the given set, but not in both.
Inserts the elements of another set into this option set.
Hashes the essential components of the value by feeding them into the given hasher.
The hash value.
Creates an empty option set.
Creates a new set from a finite sequence of items.
Creates a set containing the elements of the given array literal.
Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder, when the type’s
is
Creates a unit from a corresponding raw value.
Adds the given element to the option set if it is not already a member.
Returns a new option set with only the elements contained in both this set and the given set.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set has no members in common with the given set.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the set has no elements.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether this set is a strict subset of the given set.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether this set is a strict superset of the given set.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set is a subset of another set.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the set is a superset of the given set.
The raw value of the unit.
Removes the given element and all elements subsumed by it.
Removes the elements of the given set from this set.
Returns a new set containing the elements of this set that do not occur in the given set.
Returns a new option set with the elements contained in this set or in the given set, but not in both.
Returns a new option set of the elements contained in this set, in the given set, or in both.
Inserts the given element into the set.
A value that allows the use of all byte-count units.
A value that indicates a format style should express byte counts in individual bytes.
A value that indicates a format style should use the most appropriate units to express a byte count.
The exabytes unit.
The gigabytes unit.
The kilobytes unit.
The megabytes unit.
The petabytes unit.
The terabytes unit.
A value that indicates a format style should express byte counts as yottabytes or higher.
The zettabytes unit.
The type of units used when initializing from an array literal.
The type of elements in the option set.
The type this structure uses to store its raw value.
